title: Cazenovia Fat Bike Race
description: The inaugural Cazenovia Fat Bike Race on Sunday, February 8, 2015 will follow a multilap format, utilizing groomed trails on the Lorenzo State Historic Site and the future home of Farmstead Brewery in Cazenovia, NY.
course: Fat Bike riders will compete to log the most laps in 45 or 90 minutes on a closed course that will take them on a loop consisting of double track, single track and weather permitting, lots of snow!

title: UNITED'S RUBAIX RACE SERIES p/b CHAMPION SYSTEM s/b by ROY'S S

Macho Foundation Mtn Bike Race
description:
The Bicycle Planet MACHO Mtn Bike Race.
Race through the trails in Stillwell Woods Preserve, located in Woodbury, NY. With course for Categories 1, 2 & 3 athletes of all different skill levels can join in the fun. This Race will benefit The MACHO Foundation. Join us and LIVE the MACHO lifestyle by embracing the message encoded in their acronym; MY ACTIONS CAN HELP OTHERS!
course:
The Macho Mountain Bike Race will use the trail system in Stillwell Woods. While we have a course planned it is subject to CHANGE. We will be working with CLIMB, (Concerned Long Island Mountain Bicyclists) who will help us make sure we preserve the trails in Stillwell Woods. 

The MISSION of CLIMB.
Concerned Long Island Mountain Bicyclists (CLIMB) was established in 1990 as a non-profit advocacy organization dedicated to the growth and safe enjoyment of mountain bicycling. We promote a strong relationship between recreation and conservation by educating the mountain bicycling community on environmentally sound and socially responsible trail use.
registration:
Enter Online

Refund Policy
What We Offer
There are No Refunds and entries are Not Transferable.
However, if you are injured, simply email us at RaceAwesome@RaceAwesome.com and explain your injury. We will then offer you the opportunity to come and work at the event you registered for. In return for working at the event, we will roll your entry over to the same race the following year at no charge. We don't require a doctor's note, honesty is just fine for us.
directions:
Visit Official Race Website for directions 

http://www.raceawesome.com/macho-mountain-bike-race.html

The Rock Criterium
description: Held in the Village of Mount Morris and Sponsored by American Rock Salt, The Rock Criterium is one of the most exciting regional races on the calendar. The race features more than $2,000 in cash prizes and hundreds more in swag, the opportunity for most racers to race twice, immediate and accurate results, and one of the most exciting courses any where. The Rock is must for your criterium race calendar.
course: Featuring 6 corners with a mix of left and right turns, a significant elevation change on the "horse shoe," and one funky S curve that leaves racers constantly looking for the right line, this is one of the best courses in crit racing.
directions: 1.5 miles west off from I390 exit 7.

title: The Rock Criterium and Gran Fondo
description: Under the title sponsorship of American Rock Salt, The Rock Criterium and Gran Fondo is a two-day bicycling celebration that provides a unique format of racing and riding. This year's event will couple race categories for riders of all abilities and ages on Saturday with a scenic, professionally supported timed ride and party for recreational riders of all abilities and ages on Sunday.
course:
With course options that will accommodate and challenge both beginners and expert cyclists alike this new event is sure to be a hit. The longest course, our Gran Fondo, is only for our most experienced riders. With more than 100 miles and more than 8,000 feet of climbing, this ride will challenge even the best climbers while showcasing some of the most beautiful roads in Livingston and Allegany counties. 

For our intermediate and beginner riders we have challenges of 60 (Medio Fondo) and 30 (Piccolo Fondo) miles that also feature beautiful roads, supported rest stops and excellent challenges for all cyclists.
notes:
The Gran Fondo distance (the 103 mile course) is for experts ONLY and will have cut off times installed on course. This course is VERY challenging. Even riders who have ridden century rides in the past may have trouble due to extreme elevation. If you're not familiar with what "8000 ft" means, this distance is probably not for you. 
All fondo distances are timed but NONE are races. All riders MUST follow the "rules of the road." All roads are open to traffic. Any rider who breaks the "rules of the road" will be disqualified and banned from future events. If you have questions, please contact promoter.
All riders must have a helmet at all times.
All riders must sign a waiver.
All riders receive a free post-ride Lasagna dinner from Questa Lasagna 
All riders who register prior to July 1 first will receive a free event tee-shirt. 
Race day mechanical support provided by Bike Loft East Neutral Support

Media
www.ridelcc.com
https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Rock-Criterium-A-Running-and-Cycling-Festival/696574443691928
Twiter:@therockcrit
Instagram: ridelcc
directions:
From Buffalo take I90 East to I390 South to Exit 7 (Mount Morris/Letchworth State Park. Take 408 South into Mount Morris.

From Rochester/Syracuse I90 West to I390 South to Exit 7 (Mount Morris/Letchworth State Park. Take 408 South into Mount Morris.

From Binghamton/NYC I86 West to I390N to Exit 7 (Mount Morris/Letchworth State Park). Take 408 South into Mount Morris.

title: Syracuse Bicycle Women on Wheels
description:
Whether you are entirely new to the sport, interested in triathlons, looking to get into shape, or just want to make some great friends, the Syracuse Bicycle Women on Wheels Cycling Program is here to help you out. Our aim is to get you to love riding your bike just as much as we do by creating a safe, friendly and fun environment. Our hope is to build up your confidence by riding with other women and learning the basics of cycling.

Women on Wheels is an instructional, “no drop” cycling program. The first 15-20 minutes of each ride is dedicated to teaching you more about how to be a more confident cyclist – flat repair, how to shift, pedaling efficiently, even what to wear when riding. No drop means there will always by a ride leader bringing up the rear to make sure no rider is left behind. We ride alongside you as well, teaching you how to get the most enjoyment out of your time in the saddle. We’re offering two levels: Introductory WOW for the very beginner, and Advanced WOW for the graduates of our previous sessions or local experienced women riders looking for a great group ride experience. Introductory WOW riders only need to have a bicycle in good working order and must be able to ride in a straight line. Our Advanced WOW program will focus more on developing your fitness and fine tuning your skills as a rider.  We expect Advanced WOW riders to have a road bike and already be comfortable riding 20 miles in a group situation. Ride distances will gradually increase over the session to prepare you for the 50-mile Spokerride, if you choose. Both groups will meet on the same nights. Advanced WOW will get started riding right away and Beginner WOW will have their pre-ride 20 minute lesson before heading out.
registration:
Each 10-week session costs a total of $170 ($100 for the program fee and $70 for your annual registration fee with USA Cycling.*)  Your program fee includes two 90-min cycling classes each week and a Syracuse Bicycle cycling jersey. Entry into an end-of-session race/charity ride is encouraged, but not included in the class fee.

Option to join for Sundays only, or Thursdays only is available and costs a total of $120 ($50 for the program fee and $70 for your annual registration fee with USA Cycling.*) *An annual registration license with USA Cycling is a required purchase to participate in this program for insurance reasons. 

Session Two: Thursday, August 13 - October 25, 2015. Midf-session event is the 25-mile or 50-mile Syracuse Bicycle Breast Cancer Awareness Ride on Saturday, October 3, 2015. 

Classes held weekly on Thursdays 6:00pm and Sundays at 8:30am (occasionally on Saturdays) at various locations including: Onondaga Lake Park, Green Lakes State Park, Jamesville Beach County Park, and Oneida Shores County Park. Ride Schedule will be emailed to you after registration.

title: Point to Pint Ride
description:
HOW FAR WILL YOU RIDE FOR A BEER? 

The Point to Pint Ride is for cyclists who enjoy great beer, phenomenal scenery, the company of fellow riders and the opportunity to push themselves on a 100-mile, 50-mile, or 25-mile challenging course. 

Full pint or 100-mile riders start their day with a pre-ride breakfast at Empire Brewing Company in the heart of Armory Square in Syracuse, NY. 

Half Pint or 50-mile riders head out after lunch, arriving back at Empire in time to enjoy the post ride party with our Full Pint participants. 

New this year - The Sampler! A 25-mile "taste" of our local roadways. Your day begins at 2:30pm and brings you back in time for the post ride party at Empire!
registration:
Registration at http://www.active.com/syracuse-ny/cycling/races/point-to-pint-ride-2015
RIDER PACKET PICKUP @Syracuse Bicycle on SATURDAY, August 22nd, 10am-4:30pm. SAVE TIME, AVOID LONG LINES AND GET YOUR NUMBER ON SATURDAY!
notes:
FULL PINT/100-mile ride Schedule of Events
8:30am-10:00am Rider Check In & Pre-Ride Breakfast at Empire Brewing Company
**We will allow two start times – 9am and 10am. Cyclists needing more time to complete the course may start at 9am. All other riders will start at 10am.
**All Riders must be off the course and enjoying a cold beverage of their choice by 5:00pm. This will be strictly enforced!
4:00-5:00pm Riders Arrive Empire Brewing Company
4:00-7:00pm Post party at Empire Brewing Company

HALF PINT/50-mile ride Schedule of Events
12:00-1:00pm Rider Check-in & Pre-Ride Snacks at Empire Brewing Company
1:00pm Riders depart Empire Brewing Company
4:00-6:00 Riders arrive Empire Brewing Company
4:00-7:00 Post event party at Empire Brewing Company

THE SAMPLER/25-mile ride Schedule of Events
1:30-2:30pm Rider Check-in & Pre-Ride Snacks at Empire Brewing Company
2:30pm Riders depart Empire Brewing Company
4:00-5:00pm Riders arrive Empire Brewing Company
4:00-7:00 Post event party at Empire Brewing Company

*COME READY TO RIDE: We do NOT have space available at Empire Brewing for gear storage BEFORE, DURING, OR AFTER the ride. Please plan on keeping all personal belonging secured in your vehicle while you are on course.

*Please remember, this is a RIDE not a RACE and the COURSE IS NOT CLOSED TO TRAFFIC. You must obey all NYS Traffic Laws, to include: riding only two abreast, riding single file when a car is passing, stopping at ALL traffic signs/signals and no headphones please.

*The course, while stunningly beautiful, is also complex with many turns. We have endeavored to mark every single decision point (i.e. whenever you have a choice to go right, left or straight) with WHITE ARROWS and P2P markings. Please bring a cue sheet and map with you!

*SAG support on course: Limited. There is a mechanic following all rides. If you run into trouble, we’re there to help…when we can get you! Riders should bring along flat repair supplies as you would on any self-supported ride. Also please call 315-263-7575 if you need help at any point on the course.

*AID Stations: We will have fully stocked aid stations at Mile 25, Mile 50, and Mile 75 on the 100-mile route, at the Mile 25 mark on the Half Pint route, and at the Mile 12.5 mark on the The Sampler route. (There is an option to stop at Mile 30 on the Half Pint route at Chittenango Falls Park). There will be water, Gatorade, energy bars, fruit, cookies, PB&J, and all kinds of junk food available.
directions:
Starts/Ends at Empire Brewing Company
120 Walton St. 
Syracuse, NY 13202

*PARKING: There are several parking options in Armory Square very close to Empire Brewing Company which is located at 120 Walton St. Please refer to this website for detailed parking information: http://www.armorysq.org/about/ParkingBrochure.pdf

*POST RIDE PARTY: There is no secure location for bicycles during the post ride party. Please plan on securing your bicycle inside or to your personal vehicle BEFORE coming to the party. There are bathrooms where you can change, but no showers available at Empire.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT OF OUR LOCAL CHALLENGED ATHLETES!

title: Syracuse Bicycle Breast Cancer Awareness Ride
description: Syracuse Bicycle is hosting their 7th Annual Breast Cancer Awareness Ride on Saturday, October 3rd, at Green Lakes State Park in Fayetteville, NY.  Participants can choose between three great ride options: a 10-mile family-friendly ride on the Erie Canal Path, a 25-mile or a 50-mile road ride on a scenic, flat loop north of Green Lakes State Park. Proceeds from the event will benefit the Carol M. Baldwin Breast Cancer Research Foundation of Central New York.  This means that money donated will say local, helping more women and their families right here in CNY! All riders will receive a gift bag, a chance to win fabulous door prizes, and fully catered post-ride lunch by Angotti’s Family Restaurant. On-course support provided by The Rabin Law Firm. Participating breast cancer survivors will receive a special gift , to be announced.
course: Riders can choose from a 50 mile road ride, a 25 mile road ride or a 10 mile fun ride on the Erie Canal Towpath.
registration:
http://www.active.com/fayetteville-ny/cycling/races/syracuse-bicycle-breast-cancer-awareness-ride-2015
Registration is $40. Fundraising is encouraged to support the Carol M. Baldwin Breast Cancer Research Fund of CNY.
notes:
RIDE SCHEDULE:

8:00am-9:30am – Day-of Rider Registration Open.
8:30am – 50-mile Ride Departs *note earlier start time!.
10:00am – 25-mile Ride Departs.
10:30am – 10-mile Ride on the Erie Canal Departs.
11:30pm – Lunch by Angotti’s Family Restaurant.
12:30pm – Survivors Presentation and Door Prizes Raffle.

BREAST CANCER SURVIVORS: Please email trish@syracusebicycle.com with your name! We have a special gift for each survivor that rides with us.

BIKE RAFFLE: We’ll be selling raffle tickets for a beautiful new bike!

FUNDRAISING: New this year! If you raise $200, you’ll receive a commemorative Breast Cancer Ride jersey.  If you raise $75 you’ll receive a pair of pink “Cancer Sucks Socks”. Fundraising information here! 

 

PRIZES FOR TOP MALE AND TOP FEMALE FUNDRAISERS: raise the most money, and get an awesome prize!

TEAM/CLUB CHALLENGE: If you are affiliated with CNY Triathlon or Onondaga Cycling Club or any other club, please be sure you noted that during your online registration. The Club with the most rider participation earns their club a special shopping night/happy hour at Syracuse Bicycle on Thursday, October 16th, 6-9pm. We’re offering you our best prices of the year – deals you only see at our Anniversary Sale in November – just for you and on only this one night!

MEMORY TAGS – As in past years, we will be selling “I RIDEFOR…” tags for $5 at the ride.   Questions? Email trish@syracusebicycle.com

Check out photos from the event on our Facebook page!
directions: 7900 Green Lakes Road, Fayetteville, NY. Event is held on the grassy picnic area near the beach playground.

title: New York State Cyclocross Championships - Presented by Plan2Peak
Dave Panella Memorial Cyclocross Race
description:
Dave Panella Memorial Cyclocross Race was started in memory of a fellow cyclist who bravely battled cancer.  Beginning this year, all proceeds will go to a “wounded warriors” type of charity to assist those who fought for us and are in a time of need.  
This year, the race is part of the CNY cross cup where racers compete to gain points across a series races for a cash prize at the end of the season.

As always, this will be a local cycling and community event.  Join us for the race and festivities afterward!
course:
This year’s course will be slightly different.  The course will be longer and have additional areas for spectators to watch.

The course will consist mostly of grass with sections of hills, off camber and tight turns.  As a note of caution, there is a steep downhill into a parking lot of gravel and asphalt.  The course will include a typical cross barrier .  A neutral support it will be provided.  The course is closed to traffic.
registration: Please take advantage of the preregistration available at bikereg.com.  Day of registration will be available starting at 9:30 AM and closing 15 minutes prior to the race.
directions:
Location: one Lions way, Greene, New York
From north: take route 12 south to Greene, turn left on route 206 east, cross railroad tracks, turn right onto Lions way.
From south: Follow route 12 north to Greene, turn right onto 206 east and right on to lines way.
From I-88 westbound take Bainbridge exit and follow 206 West to Greene, left on lion’s way.
From the Ithaca area, take route 79 east to Whitney Point, turn left on route 206 east follow to Greene, take right on lion’s way.
